catalog_info.title: Introduction to the Theory of Computation
catalog_info.notes: Students may not receive credit for both CS 121 and CS 125.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: experience in formal mathematics at the level of Computer Science 20.
catalog_info.description: General introduction to the theory of computation, teaching how to reason precisely about computation and prove mathematical theorems about its capabilities and limitations. Finite automata, Turing machines, formal languages, computability, uncomputability, computational complexity, and the P vs. NP question.
